result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyshawn Joseph Walker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyshawn Joseph Walker was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO JUNE S. OS

Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
As to Count 1:  Court orders defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
- Full-time work and/or school. 
- Perform 40 hours of community service. 
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Defendant to pay all costs fees and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation or civil judgment.

Court will consider motion for expungement in upon successful completion of probation.

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for an adjournment. Court ordered that and defense motions must be submitted to the Court at least 20 days prior to the motion hearing date, and any written response by the State is due 10 days prior to the motion hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Motion Hearing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Defense to file any motions by 08-12-2015.  Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Leija contacted court to schedule case for motion hearing.  Case scheduled for scheduling conference on 7-09-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.

Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Tyshawn Joseph Walker in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
